replies.bodyText:
This comes from the append[oneSpace].
The document looks like:
idlist<6|  //x
>a
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6 6 "  //x\n": HiddenRegionReplacer: space=' ';newLine=0

The issue here is that my test TabAndSpacesSupportingWhiteSpaceReplacer is not smart enough. It's not really meant to provide the correct answer to this test (it was to illustrate the issue in ML comments). It naively always adds the space which was set to one by the oneSpace. This is normally prevented by using a separate boolean for space indentation (instead of reusing space) and then making sure the spaceIndentation is decreased at the end of the comment such as done in step 1 in the HiddenRegionReplacer.
